intro: Achyronychia palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's achyronychia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
